summary: This FBI 302 report documents spontaneous utterances made by Jeffrey Epstein during his arrest and transport on July 6, 2019. Epstein asked if the arrest was about 'sex trafficking' and 'underage' matters, and later stated 'This is going back to 2002, 2005' and 'This is pretty bad.' The report notes Epstein requested counsel and was not intoxicated.

persons.name: Jeffrey E. Epstein
persons.context: The subject of the arrest and investigation; made spontaneous utterances about sex trafficking and underage matters during transport and processing.

events.title: Arrest and Transport of Jeffrey Epstein
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein was arrested by the FBI arrest team and transported from Teterboro Airport, New Jersey, to Manhattan for processing. During transport and processing, he made spontaneous utterances about sex trafficking and underage matters, and referenced years 2002 and 2005.

events.title: Memorialization of Utterances
events.description: The author memorialized Epstein's spontaneous utterances in writing on the inside of the working folder pertaining to Epstein's arrest paperwork.

locations: Arrest processing room (JABS) on the 27th floor, New York, NY
keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein spontaneously asked agents during transport: 'Is this about sex trafficking', 'Is this about underage'.
Epstein later stated during processing: 'This is going back to 2002,2005', 'Oh this is bad', 'This is pretty bad'.
Epstein requested the assistance of counsel upon arrest.
Epstein did not appear intoxicated or under the influence and declined medical assistance.
The spontaneous utterances were memorialized in writing by the author on July 8, 2019.
